meanings.definition: Characterized by or causing cohesion or unity.
meanings.sent1: The team's cohesive effort led to a successful project completion.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle pieces were so cohesive that they stayed together even when lifted.
meanings.sent3: The group's cohesive spirit made them unstoppable in the competition.
meanings.sent4: The family's bond was so cohesive, it felt like they could conquer any challenge together.
meanings.sent5: The glue was so cohesive that once it dried, nothing could separate the pieces.

meanings.sent1: The cohesive tape kept the papers neatly in place.
meanings.sent2: The dough was so cohesive that it formed a perfect ball.
meanings.sent3: The cohesive magnets attracted each other with a strong force.
meanings.sent4: The cohesive mud made it difficult for the hikers to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The cohesive fabric of the dress ensured it stayed intact throughout the event.

meanings.sent1: The diverse group of students became cohesive after working on a project together.
meanings.sent2: The different elements of the design were cohesive and complemented each other.
meanings.sent3: The cohesive flavors of the dish created a delightful culinary experience.
meanings.sent4: The cohesive voices of the choir blended harmoniously during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The cohesive structure of the building stood strong against the storm.
